content.description: Climb delicately on top of the flake and pull some powerful and steep moves to enduro 11+ edging. Crimpy and powerful crux at the anchors. Make sure to stick the first bolt like the rest of the routes on the wall.
content.location: Currently the second route on the ledge. Begins on top of a thin fragile flake. Make sure to stick clip the first bolt at 10 feet and use the belay bolt.

content.description: Climb great pockets to a thin crux, punch it a bit to a last bolt and the anchors.
content.location: Currently (5/18/2019) ThirdÂ route on the ledge. Look for a belay bolt right before the ledge thins out and you have to squeeze behind a precarious flake.

content.description: Stick the first bolt or two silly you're on a ledge! Pull powerful and steep moves to a decent rest. Climb a thin, technical yet also powerful crux and follow glorious, albeit hidden 1 pad edges to the anchors
content.location: (Currently) the first route on the ledge. Look for a belay bolt at the large 6' flat portion of the ledge. Route starts with a high LH undercling. Again please stick clip.

content.description:
This was bolted on lead. During the first aid ascent, the leader had a bat hook placement fail and took a short ground fall. Later that day while cleaning, a rock was removed which accidentally disturbed a sleeping bat. The rock looks a lot better from the ground than it actually is at the top.

Caution: The topout has a lot of dirty and loose rock.
content.location: Starts out of the river bottom and climbs the gray prow.
